lines.speaker: u6912
lines.text: Right -- well, then we have something of an impasse.  I tell you what -- I'll call the police -- and,	what can I say? -- If I'm wrong about the whole book-down-the-trousers scenario, I really apologize.

lines.speaker: u6911
lines.text: Okay -- what if I did have a book down my trousers?

lines.speaker: u6912
lines.text: Well, ideally, when I went back to the desk, you'd remove the Cadogan guide to Bali from your trousers, and either wipe it and put it back, or buy it.  See you in a sec.

lines.speaker: u6913
lines.text: Put him in Doctor Spivey's office!

lines.speaker: u6933
lines.text: Yes, Miss Ratched...

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Ahhh, Billy...

lines.speaker: u6914
lines.text: P-p-p-please duh-duh-duh-duh t-t tell, M-M-M-Miss R-R-Ratched, y-y you don't need to!

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Say... God Bless America!

lines.speaker: u6915
lines.text: God Bless America.

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Goddammit, you sly son-of-a-bitch! Does anybody else know?

lines.speaker: u6915
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Shit! This is too much!  Chief, I tell you we're gonna bust outta this place an' make it all the way to Canada before they know what bit 'em.

lines.speaker: u6915
lines.text: Ca-na-da...

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Ya like that, Chief, huh?

lines.speaker: u6915
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Yeah, well, well, well. 'Bout time the rest of the world got a gander at Big Chief Bromden cuttin' down the boulevard, stopping just long enough for virgins... Oh, man, I tell you, I tell you, you'll have women trippin' you and beating you to the floor...

lines.speaker: u6915
lines.text: Ca-na-da...

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Shhh, Chief, don't talk. Never talk! Remember, this is just between you an' me. Do ya understand?

lines.speaker: u6916
lines.text: Go with him, Rose. Go with him.

lines.speaker: u6927
lines.text: Well, okay, but I just want to look at the facilities. That's all.

lines.speaker: u6917
lines.text: When do you think we'll be going back, Mack?

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Come here a minute, Cheswick. You, too, Sefelt. Hey, all you guys, come over here, I wanna show you somethin'.

lines.speaker: u6929
lines.text: Ya know what, Fred?

lines.speaker: u6918
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u6919
lines.text: Big king, too bad...

lines.speaker: u6929
lines.text: Just wait till you hear...

lines.speaker: u6919
lines.text: Hear what?

lines.speaker: u6929
lines.text: McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped...

lines.speaker: u6919
lines.text: When?

lines.speaker: u6929
lines.text: Yesterday...

lines.speaker: u6919
lines.text: Who told you that?

lines.speaker: u6929
lines.text: Gary Blinker...

lines.speaker: u6928
lines.text: Gary Blinker's fulla shit!

lines.speaker: u6920
lines.text: He's not!

lines.speaker: u6928
lines.text: He is!

lines.speaker: u6921
lines.text: Hey, Billy, stop cryin'. You don't have to cry... You ain't got nothin' to be ashamed of. She ain't gonna tell you mother... stop crying...

lines.speaker: u6933
lines.text: Yes, Miss Ratched!

lines.speaker: u6923
lines.text: I want those men put back to bed, Mister Turkle!

lines.speaker: u6932
lines.text: Yes, ma'am...

lines.speaker: u6923
lines.text: And you haven't heard the last of this!

lines.speaker: u6932
lines.text: Yes, ma'am...

lines.speaker: u6932
lines.text: Now, Miss. What do you want with twenty zombies when you got a twenty gun salute looking you right in the face.

lines.speaker: u6927
lines.text: Oh, yeah...

lines.speaker: u6932
lines.text: You better believe it, you sweet little thing. You better believe it...

lines.speaker: u6927
lines.text: Don't you sweet talk me you ol' spook, you!

lines.speaker: u6932
lines.text: Oh, I'm all through talkin'. Now, let's just you an' me trip on down that hall.

lines.speaker: u6934
lines.text: She was your sister.

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: No, she wasn't my sister.

lines.speaker: u6934
lines.text: Your mother.

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: Of course not.

lines.speaker: u6934
lines.text: Your grandmother?

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: Look, she wasn't a relative, okay? I don't know who she is.

lines.speaker: u6935
lines.text: You didn't have that with you before.  Prima non l'aveva con se.

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: It was late in arriving.  But it's here now.

lines.speaker: u6936
lines.text: He said he thinks a woman he works with knows him.  Her name's Anna. But she won't be in 'til tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: So.  How do we get to Rome?

lines.speaker: u6937
lines.text: Were they pen pals?

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u6937
lines.text: Is he some kind of celebrity or something?

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u6937
lines.text: Did he do some anonymous good deed for her?

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u6938
lines.text: My name isn't Damon Bradley.  I just told you it was Damon Bradley.

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: What is it?

lines.speaker: u6945
lines.text: Who's dying?

lines.speaker: u6939
lines.text: Your great aunt.

lines.speaker: u6945
lines.text: What great aunt?

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: I'm fine.  Have you seen Peter?

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: He's gone.  He told me what happened.  He just left for the airport.

lines.speaker: u6940
lines.text: Larry, did you rent a car?

lines.speaker: u6942
lines.text: You think I'm just one of those Italian Casanovas.  The guys who try to seduce every woman who comes their way.  Who prey on unhappily married women.  Who lure unsuspecting--

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: Giovanni.

lines.speaker: u6942
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: That's exactly what you are.

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: Oh, it's you.  It's only Peter.

lines.speaker: u6947
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u6944
lines.text: Sorry...

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Right now?

lines.speaker: u6949
lines.text: He just got a call from "Mr. Upstairs." Something's gone wrong. He's plenty hot.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I'm gonna take her home first.

lines.speaker: u6949
lines.text: I'd get over there, Terry. I'll take the little lady home.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I'll come over when I'm ready.

lines.speaker: u6949
lines.text: You know Johnny when he gets mad.

lines.speaker: u6952
lines.text: You mean to sit there and tell me that your local takes in sixty-five thousand, five hundred dollars every year and keeps no financial records?

lines.speaker: u6950
lines.text: Sure we keep records!

lines.speaker: u6952
lines.text: Well, where are they?

lines.speaker: u6950
lines.text: We was robbed last night and we can't find no books.

lines.speaker: u6952
lines.text: Doesn't it seem odd to you that five different waterfront locals were broken into last night and the only articles removed were financial records?

lines.speaker: u6950
lines.text: What do you mean, odd? We was robbed like I told you.

lines.speaker: u6952
lines.text: That's all. Next witness!

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: It was you, Charley... .

lines.speaker: u6951
lines.text: Okay I'll tell him I couldn't bring you in. Ten to one they won't believe it, but go ahead, blow. Jump out, quick, and keep going... and God help you from here on in.

lines.speaker: u6965
lines.text: Where you goin'?

lines.speaker: u6953
lines.text: Let me by.

lines.speaker: u6954
lines.text: You still call it ratting?

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: Are you on the level, Father?

lines.speaker: u6954
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: If I stick my neck out, and they chopped it off, would that be the end of it? Or are you ready to go all the way?

lines.speaker: u6954
lines.text: I'll go down the line, Kayo, believe me.

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: Baseball bats that's just for openers. They'll put the muscle on you, turned-around collar or no turned-around collar.

lines.speaker: u6954
lines.text: And I still say you stand up and I'll stand up with you.

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: Down to the wire?

lines.speaker: u6954
lines.text: So help me God!

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: Well, I had my fun, I've drunk my fill and I tickled some good-lookin' fillies I'm on borried time.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Where you going? I'll walk along with you.

lines.speaker: u6955
lines.text: Sure... .

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: Some chance at ten percent a week! And if he don't borrow, he don't work.

lines.speaker: u6956
lines.text: You'll work.

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: I ought to belt you one, J.P.

lines.speaker: u6956
lines.text: Raise a hand to me and... .

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: ... .and you'll tell Johnny Friendly.

lines.speaker: u6956
lines.text: You'd be off the pier for good.

lines.speaker: u6957
lines.text: Didn't you recognize him, dopey. That's Old Man Doyle.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Doyle.  Joey Doyle's... .?  ... .You're his... .

lines.speaker: u6958
lines.text: Hey, Terry, guess who's here... that joker from the Commission... .

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Looking for me?

lines.speaker: u6958
lines.text: He's got his nerve, gum-shoeing around here after what you told him.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Jimmy, suppose I knew something, say a mug somebody put on somebody... .  You think I should turn him in?

lines.speaker: u6958
lines.text: A cheese-eater!  You're kidding!

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Yeah, I'm kidding, I'm kidding. You don't think I should turn him in... .

lines.speaker: u6958
lines.text: You was a Golden Warrior.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Yeah us Golden Warriors.  You're a good kid, Jimmy, a good tough kid. We stick together, huh, kid?

lines.speaker: u6958
lines.text: You was our first Supreme Commander, Terry. Keep out of sight and I'll tell him you're out.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: But I ain't out. I'm in. I'm in. Who's lying to who?

lines.speaker: u6959
lines.text: You ought to go home and take care of that

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: First things first.

lines.speaker: u6960
lines.text: Yeah? Must be Danny-boy. I lost him in the last race.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: He followed my birds into their coop. Here, you want him?

lines.speaker: u6960
lines.text: Well I got to watch myself these days. Know what I mean?

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I'll bring him up to your loft.

lines.speaker: u6960
lines.text: I'll see you on the roof.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: You want to know something? Take the heater away and you're nothin' take the good goods away, and the kickback and the shakedown cabbage away and the pistoleros  away and you're a great big hunk of nothing  Your guts is all in your wallet and your trigger finger!

lines.speaker: u6961
lines.text: Go on talkin'. You're talkin' yourself right into the river. Go on, go on... .

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I'm glad what I done today, see? You give it to Joey, you give it to Nolan, you give it to Charley who was one of your own. You thought you was God Almighty instead of a cheap connivinggood-for-nothing bum! So I'm glad what I done you hear me? glad what I done!

lines.speaker: u6961
lines.text: You ratted on us, Terry.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: From where you stand, maybe. But I'm standing over here now. I was rattin' on myself all them years and didn't know it, helpin' punks like you against people like Pop and Nolan an'... .

lines.speaker: u6961
lines.text: Come on. I want you. You're mine. You're mine! Come on!

lines.speaker: u6962
lines.text: You know what I mean. Leave her alone.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I was only talkin' to her.

lines.speaker: u6962
lines.text: She's off limits for bums like you. Leave her alone.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: I can look at her, can't I? It's a free country.

lines.speaker: u6962
lines.text: Not that free.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Yeah, yeah Here's half a buck, go have yourself a ball.

lines.speaker: u6963
lines.text: I can't believe it a small fortune.   You can't buy me you're still a bum!  'Bye, Edie. Lord have mercy on Joey.

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Look who says bum!

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Listen Nolan

lines.speaker: u6964
lines.text: What are you down here for to see we don't make off with any of Mister Friendly's precious cargo?

lines.speaker: u6967
lines.text: Nolan... .

lines.speaker: u6971
lines.text: I love you Bob. I really do. Forgive me?

lines.speaker: u6968
lines.text: There's nothing to forgive. It was all a dream.

lines.speaker: u6971
lines.text: You love me then?

lines.speaker: u6968
lines.text: Of course I do.

lines.speaker: u6971
lines.text: No. No! No!

lines.speaker: u6969
lines.text: I repulse you? Very well. It seems you have chosen your own fate. Live with it! I should say die with it!

lines.speaker: u6972
lines.text: I could make her another Cleopatra...

lines.speaker: u6973
lines.text: Ahh hahahhnnn hahnnn!

lines.speaker: u6972
lines.text: Without the snake, of course.

lines.speaker: u6974
lines.text: I don't know where he is.

lines.speaker: u6978
lines.text: Listen, I'm the one help Jack escape from prison.  He tole me, I can't find him to see you.  So why don't you open this fucking door.  Okay?  So we can speak.

lines.speaker: u6974
lines.text: Go away, or I'll call the police.

lines.speaker: u6978
lines.text: Why you want to do that, to a frien'?

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: No, you dump the van, meet me at the airport. I'll take one of Ripley's cars.

lines.speaker: u6975
lines.text: Jack --

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: Listen, Buddy, the shit that's about to go down, you'll be on the phone with your sister for a month.  Let me do this part alone.

lines.speaker: u6976
lines.text: Now you see Foley and this guy Bragg come in behind us, whatta you do?

lines.speaker: u6983
lines.text: Call and tell you.

lines.speaker: u6976
lines.text: And you let them come up.  You don't try to make the bust yourself.  You understand?

lines.speaker: u6977
lines.text: You see what they doing, those posts out there?  Putting up another fence, five metres on the other side of the one that's there.  We wait until Super Bowl Sunday, they could have the second fence built and we have to dig another nine, ten days.  So we going soon as it's dark.  You want -- I mean it -- you can still come.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: I appreciate the offer.  And it's tempting.

lines.speaker: u6979
lines.text: Karen, I told you not to--

lines.speaker: u6983
lines.text: Wait, I know him --okay?

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: Hejira? What kinda name is that?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Islamic.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: What's it mean, "No Hair"?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: The Hejira was the flight of Mohammed from Mecca in 622.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: The flight?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: The brothers in Leavenworth gave me the name.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: You were at Leavenworth, huh?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: For a time.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: Meaning?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Meaning time came, I left.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: You busted out?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: I prefer to call it an exodus from an undesirable place.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: And how long was it before they caught up with you?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: That time?

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: There were others.

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Yeah.  That was the ninth.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: The <u>ninth</u>?

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Ten, you count the prison hospital in Ohio I walked away from.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: You must be some kinda walker, Henry.

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Hejira.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: And so now you're off to Glades.

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Apparently, yeah.  I was supposed to leave last night with the lady marshal, but for some reason she wanted to wait.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: She did, huh.

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Cheaper I guess, take us both down in one van.

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: Yeah, could be.  Or maybe she thought we'd have a lot to talk about.

lines.speaker: u6982
lines.text: Like what?

lines.speaker: u6980
lines.text: I don't know.  It's a long way down to Florida.

lines.speaker: u6981
lines.text: It's all right with you, I'll just hang in the car.

lines.speaker: u6987
lines.text: No.  You gonna stay close to me from now on.  So you don't disappear on me.

lines.speaker: u6981
lines.text: Why would I do that?

lines.speaker: u6986
lines.text: You gonna go get him?

lines.speaker: u6983
lines.text: It's possible.  Why?

lines.speaker: u6986
lines.text: I was just thinking... you could have a nice time with him on the plane -- like picking up where your interlude, or whatever you call it, left off. And then throw him in the can.

lines.speaker: u6983
lines.text: He knew what he was doing.  Nobody forced him to rob banks.

lines.speaker: u6986
lines.text: My little girl, the tough babe.

lines.speaker: u6987
lines.text: A'ight, this time we gotta get the motherfuckin' trajectory right...  Okay, on three:  One... Two...

lines.speaker: u6985
lines.text: The combination is three-ten-forty-four.

lines.speaker: u6990
lines.text: The woman also said he stole her husband's gun, a twenty-two pistol, and some of his clothes.

lines.speaker: u6986
lines.text: So the woman's married.  She goes to bed with this prison escapee because he misses his little girl and then tells the world about it.  But you don't reveal her name, you protect her.  It sounds like you're saying it's okay as long as her husband doesn't find out about it.  Like the guy who cheats on his wife, saying what she doesn't know won't hurt her.

lines.speaker: u6987
lines.text: ...the fuck is this...

lines.speaker: u6992
lines.text: Are they dead?

lines.speaker: u6993
lines.text: What is it with Red?  I've never seen him this way.

lines.speaker: u6996
lines.text: He's been like that all day.  Hey Danny, you coming?

lines.speaker: u6995
lines.text: I wish she could forget him.

lines.speaker: u6994
lines.text: You don't forget love, Honey.  Not ever.

lines.speaker: u6995
lines.text: Do you always stutter?

lines.speaker: u7011
lines.text: Only when I'm n-n-n-

lines.speaker: u6995
lines.text: Nervous?

lines.speaker: u7011
lines.text: Yeah.  But if I have to get something out, I c-can always s-s-s-  SIIING!

lines.speaker: u6997
lines.text: On loan from Colonel Doolittle, is it?

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: That's me, Sir.

lines.speaker: u6997
lines.text: Good on you, then, Rafe McCawley.  We'll get you situated in some quarters, and then introduce you to the equipment you'll be flying.

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: If you're patching up bullet holes right here on the runway, maybe we should skip the housekeeping and get right to the planes.

lines.speaker: u6997
lines.text: Are all the Yanks as anxious as you are to get yourself killed, Lieutenant?

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: Not anxious to die, Sir, anxious to matter.

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: You're Walker, right?

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: Yes Sir.

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: That was a nice little stunt you pulled, buzzing the base.

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: You liked that?

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: Oh yeah.  I liked it so much I'm cutting you out of the squadron.

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: Sir?

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: I don't buy that hot dog shit.  So you and your buddies are gonna transfer your planes up to Haleiwa.

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: Hale-what?

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: You'll love it.  No base, no bars, just lots of sun and aircraft maintenance.

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: Sir, I --

lines.speaker: u6998
lines.text: Too late for apologies, Walker.

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: I wasn't gonna apologize, Sir.  I was just gonna say it was worth it to feel like a real pilot again, even if it was only for five seconds.

lines.speaker: u6999
lines.text: Shit, he's puking on my feet!

lines.speaker: u7011
lines.text: Well, you p-puked on his feet.

lines.speaker: u6999
lines.text: Yeah, but he was wearing shoes!

lines.speaker: u7004
lines.text: So beautiful!

lines.speaker: u7000
lines.text: Hang on.

lines.speaker: u7001
lines.text: Listen you guys.  I'm the first plane -- then McCawley, Walker, the rest of you. I'll have the shortest run.  If I don't make it, you don't go.

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: Colonel...we're all going.  Whether you make it or not.

lines.speaker: u7001
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: u7004
lines.text: You take care, Dorie.

lines.speaker: u7002
lines.text: You too, 'Mam.

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: What?...

lines.speaker: u7004
lines.text: They were bringing back a ship full of wounded and needed extra nurses along.  I wrote Colonel Doolittle, and told him I needed to see you before you go.

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: It must of been a convincing letter.

lines.speaker: u7004
lines.text: It was.  I couldn't have you go away, wherever it is...to war...without knowing something.  You think I made a choice, of Danny over you.  I didn't.  I didn't have a choice.  I'm pregnant.

lines.speaker: u7005
lines.text: If we launch the third wave and annihilate their fuel depots, we destroy their ability to operate in the Pacific for at least a year!

lines.speaker: u7013
lines.text: And if we fail, and lose our carriers, we destroy our ability to fight them at all.  As soon as the second wave returns, we will withdraw.

lines.speaker: u7006
lines.text: We have bombed Tokyo, Mr. President. Radio Tokyo interrupted it's own broadcast to make the announcement.

lines.speaker: u7012
lines.text: Have the planes made it to China?

lines.speaker: u7006
lines.text: There've been some complications, Sir. The Chinese didn't receive our request for homing beacons until is was too late to get them set.  And the planes had to take off so early they may lack fuel to make the mainland anyway.

lines.speaker: u7012
lines.text: So those brave men are flying blind and running out of fuel.

lines.speaker: u7006
lines.text: The Chinese are sending out search parties to try to find the crews before the Jap patrols do, if any of the planes make it.

lines.speaker: u7012
lines.text: God help them.

lines.speaker: u7007
lines.text: I have'na been able ta --

lines.speaker: u7010
lines.text: Crank her!

lines.speaker: u7009
lines.text: You have something to say, Yamamoto?

lines.speaker: u7013
lines.text: The Council knows I have opposed fighting the Americans.  No matter how great our resolve, they have resources beyond ours. If we must go to war, there is only one way -- deal them a blow from which it will take them years to recover.  In that time we can conquer all of the Pacific, and they will have no choice but to ask for peace.

lines.speaker: u7009
lines.text: You see us as capable of such a blow?

lines.speaker: u7013
lines.text: The Americans themselves have made it possible.  We will annihilate them in a single attack -- at Pearl Harbor.

lines.speaker: u7025

lines.text: Someone else will be going in with you.

lines.speaker: u7129
lines.text: How could anyone get through this, carry Blain out, right under our noses without leavin' a trace?

lines.speaker: u7130
lines.text: He knows our defenses.

lines.speaker: u7129
lines.text: Why didn't he try to kill one of us last night?

lines.speaker: u7131
lines.text: Your uncle will like this.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: He's not really my uncle.

lines.speaker: u7131
lines.text: They never are, dear.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: You don't know anything about me.

lines.speaker: u7132
lines.text: I'd like to find out.  You don't know anything about me either. That's why people have lunch.

lines.speaker: u7141
lines.text: You broke my nose.

lines.speaker: u7133
lines.text: I think I broke my hand.  You're fired.

lines.speaker: u7141
lines.text: Edward, we've been together ten years.

lines.speaker: u7133
lines.text: And I don't like what we've become.  I'll cover any losses you have on this one.  Now get out, you asshole!

lines.speaker: u7141
lines.text: All this because of that whore!

lines.speaker: u7133
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Couple a hours.

lines.speaker: u7135
lines.text: Yeah.  Well... I gotta split. Goodbye's make me crazy.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Cool your jets a second.  Here's some money.

lines.speaker: u7135
lines.text: No.  You took care of rent, that's enough.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: I want to.  For food, got it? Eat something before the wind blows you away.

lines.speaker: u7135
lines.text: I'm gonna pay you back next time I see ya, babe.  Just wait, I'm gonna do something real nice for you some day.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Yeah, what?

lines.speaker: u7137
lines.text: Rent.  You're late.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Don't give me that.  Kit gave it to you yesterday, cash.

lines.speaker: u7137
lines.text: Kit give me nothin'.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: You bullshittin' me?

lines.speaker: u7137
lines.text: Of rent I do not bullshit.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Is that all?  You just fold back the bedspread?

lines.speaker: u7138
lines.text: I also place las chocolates on the pillow.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Oooh, I love those.

lines.speaker: u7138
lines.text: I leave extras, miss.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Thanks!  Consuelo, are all rich people so lazy they can't do this on their own?

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Hi, Barney!

lines.speaker: u7139
lines.text: Miss Vivian.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Look I just wanted to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: u7139
lines.text: Mr. Harris doesn't check out until tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Yeah, well, I check out today.

lines.speaker: u7139
lines.text: You're not accompanying him to New York?

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Come on, Barney, you and me live in the real world.  You don't know how to treat a girl like anything but a lady, Mr. Thomas.

lines.speaker: u7139
lines.text: Certain ladies make that very easy... Vivian.  John, call a limousine for our guest, please.  Have it take her anywhere she wishes to go.  Bill the hotel.  See you again sometime soon.

lines.speaker: u7140
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Do you remember me?

lines.speaker: u7140
lines.text: No, I'm sorry, I don't.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: I was in here yesterday.

lines.speaker: u7142
lines.text: Get out!

lines.speaker: u7141
lines.text: Don't worry.  I'll pay for it. What a you charge?  Huh?  Twenty, thirty, fifty bucks, <u>maybe</u>?  Are you a fifty dollar whore?

lines.speaker: u7156
lines.text: You don't believe me?

lines.speaker: u7143
lines.text: You survived the Fire Swamp. You must be very brave...  ... but nobody withstands The Machine. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           69.

lines.speaker: u7144
lines.text: But it did. I was there. This old man said, "Man and wife."

lines.speaker: u7156
lines.text: Did you say, "I do"?

lines.speaker: u7144
lines.text: Well, no, we sort of skipped that part.

lines.speaker: u7156
lines.text: Then you're not married -- if you didn't say it, you didn't do it  -- wouldn't you agree, Your Highness?

lines.speaker: u7148
lines.text: He's getting away from me, Fezzik. Please. FEZZIK!

lines.speaker: u7145
lines.text: I'll be right back.

lines.speaker: u7153
lines.text: Maybe you could come over and read it again to me tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u7146
lines.text: As you wish...

lines.speaker: u7152
lines.text: Now, where is that secret knot? It's impossible to find.  Are you coming down into the Pit? Westley's got his strength back. I am starting him on The Machine tonight.

lines.speaker: u7147
lines.text: Tyrone, you know how much I love watching you work. But, I've got my country's five hundredth anniversary to plan, my wedding to arrange, My wife to murder, and Guilder to frame for it. I'm swamped. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           75.

lines.speaker: u7148
lines.text: I want to duel him left-handed.

lines.speaker: u7155
lines.text: You know what a hurry we're in.

lines.speaker: u7148
lines.text: Well, it's the only way I can be satisfied. If I use my right -- tch -- over too quickly.

lines.speaker: u7155
lines.text: Oh, have it your way.

lines.speaker: u7149
lines.text: You guessed wrong.

lines.speaker: u7155
lines.text: You only think I guessed wrong --  -- that's what's so funny! I switched glasses when your back was turned. You fool.

lines.speaker: u7154
lines.text: Bye-bye, boys.

lines.speaker: u7150
lines.text: Have fun storming the castle.

lines.speaker: u7154
lines.text: Think it'll work?

lines.speaker: u7150
lines.text: It would take a miracle. Bye!

lines.speaker: u7154
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: u7151
lines.text: You feeling any better?

lines.speaker: u7153
lines.text: A little bit.

lines.speaker: u7151
lines.text: Guess what.

lines.speaker: u7153
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u7151
lines.text: Your grandfather's here.

lines.speaker: u7153
lines.text: Mom, can't you tell him that I'm sick?

lines.speaker: u7151
lines.text: You are sick, that's why he's here.

lines.speaker: u7153
lines.text: He'll pinch my cheek. I hate that.

lines.speaker: u7151
lines.text: Maybe he won't.

lines.speaker: u7158
lines.text: Smasheroo.  Smasheroo.

lines.speaker: u7166
lines.text: Oh, I'd better hurry back.  I don't want to miss one minute of it.

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: Hindenburg...

lines.speaker: u7159
lines.text: Hindenburg...

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: The Graf Spee...

lines.speaker: u7159
lines.text: The Graf Spee...

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: The Blue Max...

lines.speaker: u7159
lines.text: The Blue Max...

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: And last, but not least, Adolph... you know who.

lines.speaker: u7159
lines.text: And last, but not least, Adolph... you know who.

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: Heil you know who!

lines.speaker: u7159
lines.text: Heil you know who!

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: Good.  Good.  Now ve sign the contract.

lines.speaker: u7160
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: Where are you going vit the light?

lines.speaker: u7160
lines.text: I need it.  How'm I gonna find the fuse?

lines.speaker: u7165
lines.text: Oh, ve come vit you.  All for one and all in the light.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Lorenzo Saint DuBois.  But everybody calls me LSD.

lines.speaker: u7162
lines.text: What have you done, LSD?

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Six months, I'm out on probation, but it's cool now, baby.

lines.speaker: u7162
lines.text: I mean in show business.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Oh, in show business.  Well, let's put it this way, my next job will be my debut.

lines.speaker: u7162
lines.text: What do you do best?

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Hey, man, I can't do that here, that's what they put me away for.

lines.speaker: u7162
lines.text: Oh, sing.  Sing!

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Hey, baby, that's where they put me, Sing-Sing.  How'd you know that, you been up?

lines.speaker: u7162
lines.text: Sing a song!  Just sing a song!

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Where's Goebbels?  Where's my little Joe?

lines.speaker: u7163
lines.text: Send for Goebbels.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: He's the only cat left that still grooves me.

lines.speaker: u7164
lines.text: Heil, baby!  I just finished the morning propaganda broadcasts.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: What did you tell the people?

lines.speaker: u7164
lines.text: I told them we invaded England.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Hey, baby, that's good!  How'd we come out?

lines.speaker: u7164
lines.text: We won.

lines.speaker: u7167
lines.text: Groovy!

lines.speaker: u7169
lines.text: You came up here on a hunch, Miss Crane? Nothing more? No phone call... from him, or from your sister herself?

lines.speaker: u7173
lines.text: Not even a hunch. Just hope.

lines.speaker: u7169
lines.text: With a little checking, I could get to believe you.

lines.speaker: u7173
lines.text: I don't care if you do or... I want to see Mary... before she gets in any deeper...

lines.speaker: u7170
lines.text: I think you'd better give it a trial spin. Don't want any bad word of mouth about California Charlie.

lines.speaker: u7175
lines.text: I'd really rather not. Please.  Can't we just settle this and...

lines.speaker: u7170
lines.text: I'll be perfectly honest with you, Ma'am. It's not that I don't trust you, but...

lines.speaker: u7175
lines.text: But what?  Is there anything so terribly wrong about... making a decision and wanting to hurry? Do you think I've stolen... my car?

lines.speaker: u7170
lines.text: No, M'am. I was only about to say, I've sent my mechanic out to give your car a little test... that's all.

lines.speaker: u7175
lines.text: I'd like to be ready when he gets back.

lines.speaker: u7170
lines.text: Okay. If you'll come along...

lines.speaker: u7171
lines.text: Aren't you going to take the pills?  They'll knock that headache out.

lines.speaker: u7175
lines.text: I don't need pills... just sleep.

lines.speaker: u7174
lines.text: Call her sister! If no one's answering at the house....

lines.speaker: u7172
lines.text: I called her sister, Mr. Lowery, where she works, the Music Makers Music Store, you know? And she doesn't know where Mary is any more than we do.

lines.speaker: u7174
lines.text: You better run out to the house. She may be... unable to answer the phone...

lines.speaker: u7172
lines.text: Her sister's going to do that.  She's as worried as we are.

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: It's regular. Okay?

lines.speaker: u7173
lines.text: I could stand something regular.

lines.speaker: u7179
lines.text: May I see your license?

lines.speaker: u7175
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u7179
lines.text: Please.

lines.speaker: u7181
lines.text: Went out before service.

lines.speaker: u7176
lines.text: Have you two had breakfast?

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: You look frightened. Have I been saying something frightening?

lines.speaker: u7177
lines.text: I don't know what you've been saying.

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: I've been talking about your mother... about your motel. How are you going to do it?

lines.speaker: u7177
lines.text: Do what?

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: Buy a new one! In a new town! Where you won't have to hide your mother!

lines.speaker: u7177
lines.text: Shut up!

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: Where will you get the money to do that, Bates... or do you already have it... socked away... a lot of it...

lines.speaker: u7177
lines.text: Leave me alone!

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: ...Forty thousand dollars!

lines.speaker: u7177
lines.text: Leave me alone!

lines.speaker: u7182
lines.text: I won't have you bringing strange young girls in for supper...  ...by candlelight, I suppose, in the cheap erotic fashion of young men with cheap, erotic minds!

lines.speaker: u7178
lines.text: Mother, please...

lines.speaker: u7182
lines.text: And then what? After supper, music? Whispers?

lines.speaker: u7178
lines.text: Mother, she's just a stranger... hungry, and the weather's bad...

lines.speaker: u7182
lines.text: Mother, she's just a stranger!  As if men don't desire strangers, as if... oh, I refuse to speak of disgusting things because they disgust me! You understand, Boy?

lines.speaker: u7182
lines.text: Go on, go tell her she'll not be appeasing her ugly appetite with my food... or my son! Or do I have to tell her, cause you don't have the guts? Huh, boy? You have the guts, boy?

lines.speaker: u7178
lines.text: Shut up! Shut up!

lines.speaker: u7180
lines.text: No mother.

lines.speaker: u7181
lines.text: You must've seen an illusion, Sam. Now, I know you're not the seeing- illusion type... But no woman was illusion there and I don't believe in ghosts, so there it is!

lines.speaker: u7183
lines.text: By gosh, them stiffs are get- tin' heavier and more of 'em every day. They even got the coroner working overtime.

lines.speaker: u7184
lines.text: Yeah, between the gangsters and the autos, we won't need another war to carry off the population.

lines.speaker: u7183
lines.text: You didn't even mention the suicides. Did you notice the beaut that came in today?

lines.speaker: u7184
lines.text: Did I?

lines.speaker: u7183
lines.text: That's the one that's got the coroner doing nightwork.

lines.speaker: u7184
lines.text: What--special autopsy?

lines.speaker: u7185
lines.text: Imagine--she was alive. What a horror. Could have been buried alive. She must have run away from the morgue.

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Never mind your theories. Was she ever conscious?

lines.speaker: u7185
lines.text: Just before she died she came to--

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Did she talk?

lines.speaker: u7185
lines.text: Said "doctor"--[something]

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: [Was it] "Meirschultz"?

lines.speaker: u7191
lines.text: That's what I said. Now, lis- ten to me. I want you to help me take this woman down stairs. I will give her a shot. You can take care of her till I get help.

lines.speaker: u7186
lines.text: How about me getting the help. She's quiet now, isn't she?

lines.speaker: u7187
lines.text: Yes--I can't stand it-- everybody wants papers-- oh, oh

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Take him to the psychopathic hospital.

lines.speaker: u7193
lines.text: Sure--they're sorta queer, I'd say. They's lots of queer goings on up there. They even brought a dog back to life once.

lines.speaker: u7188
lines.text: That sounds to me very remarkable.

lines.speaker: u7193
lines.text: It may be, but to my notion, those that monkeys with what they got no business to get queer sooner or later.

lines.speaker: u7188
lines.text: Maybe you're right.

lines.speaker: u7193
lines.text: I know I am. Why, I even heard a shot up there last night.

lines.speaker: u7188
lines.text: Why didn't you notify the police?

lines.speaker: u7189
lines.text: Oh, him. He has a cat of his own. But his assistant--he's the cat-hatenest man I ever saw. Goofy, if ya ast me.]

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: By the way--did you hear a shot last night?

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Take me down there.

lines.speaker: u7191
lines.text: It won't do any good. They are a pair of would-be mur- deresses fighting it out.

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Man, you're crazy. What kind of a place is this?

lines.speaker: u7191
lines.text: Oh, <U>I'm</U> crazy, am I? Let me tell you something.  Those women have--the gleam--

lines.speaker: u7190
lines.text: Come on, we're wasting time.

lines.speaker: u7191
lines.text: [Something very important. I have been threatened;] Mrs. Maxwell, my assistant's wife, is crazy.  She thinks I mur- dered her husband. [She wants to murder me.] I want you to help me quiet her-- give her a shot from this hypo. [Keep it hid till we get her] down in the basement-- there is a secret vault [there]. We will put her there till we get your husband--[then turn her over to the authorities. Then we will both be free.]

lines.speaker: u7192
lines.text: It sounds all right, except for the fact that she's crazy. It seems to me she has the right idea--.

lines.speaker: u7191
lines.text: Oh, so you feel that way too . Motions to other room. Stay in there--I'll call you when needed.

lines.speaker: u7194
lines.text: What is it now?

lines.speaker: u7197
lines.text: I'm losing my blood!

lines.speaker: u7194
lines.text: You're losing your blood?

lines.speaker: u7197
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: u7194
lines.text: Nonsense! ... It's here! ... Your blood ...

lines.speaker: u7198
lines.text: Your father?

lines.speaker: u7195
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: u7198
lines.text: The master ... is asleep!

lines.speaker: u7196
lines.text: There's no child here, and no dogs either.

lines.speaker: u7197
lines.text: No?

lines.speaker: u7196
lines.text: No!  Good night!

lines.speaker: u7200
lines.text: By the time we return there, all the preparations for the blood transfusion are completed.

lines.speaker: u7199
lines.text: Joseph returns from the room where Gisèle is. He has evidently succeeded in calming her. He goes and sits in the chair where Nikolas sat. He rests his head in his hand. He sees the open diary and begins reading it.

lines.speaker: u7200
lines.text: The blood transfusion is now in progress. The only words are curt orders like: 'Now! - Quickly! - That's enough! - Give it to me! - Sit still!' etc.

lines.speaker: u7199
lines.text: Joseph is reading the diary, which arouses his interest more and more. It is as if he finds a connection between what he reads and the fearful events that have taken place around him. An extract from the diary is shown.

lines.speaker: u7200
lines.text: The blood transfusion continues. Marc has positioned himself outside the circle of light from the lamp, so that he can see Nikolas in bright light, while he himself sits in the dark. Nikolas watches Léone's face anxiously and closely during her struggle with death. Life slowly seems to return to her, and her breathing becomes more peaceful. She opens her eyes and looks at the people round her, but she is much too enfeebled to speak, and closes her eyes again. Marc keeps a close watch on Nikolas, who grows paler and paler. His eyes swivel slowly from Nikolas to the patient and back to Nikolas again.

lines.speaker: u7199
lines.text: Another fragment of the diary is shown [having to do with vampires].

lines.speaker: u7200
lines.text: The blood transfusion is completed. While Marc himself is looking after the patient, the nurse leads Nikolas into an adjoining room, where she makes him sit down and prepares his bandage. The doctor stands bending over Léone.

lines.speaker: u7201
lines.text: You killed him!  Come on with the rest of it. You killed him!

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: No -- I didn't. It was Igor at the waxworks.

lines.speaker: u7201
lines.text: But you were in on it -- you worked for him.

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: No -- the only thing I did for him was to keep track of the man named Worth that runs the place where you arrested me tonight.

lines.speaker: u7201
lines.text: You lie!

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: It's Igor at the Wax Museum! You'll find your judge embalmed in wax! He's a statue of Voltaire, with all the other corpses! The whole place is a morgue -- do you hear? -- a morgue!

lines.speaker: u7202
lines.text: Please, oh, please, I haven't done anything to hurt you.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: And I have no desire to hurt you. You will always be beautiful. Think, my child, in a thousand years you will be as lovely as you are now.

lines.speaker: u7203
lines.text: Hey, what do you think you're doing? Put that stuff back!

lines.speaker: u7206
lines.text: Nothing doing. This is my percentage. You birds are going to get yours. And anyhow, I found this dump.

lines.speaker: u7204
lines.text: That's what I said.

lines.speaker: u7206
lines.text: I'm going to get even with you, you dirty stiff! I'll do it!

lines.speaker: u7205
lines.text: You didn't happen to be going to Worth's place, did you?

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: No, sir, I'm sure it wasn't there.

lines.speaker: u7205
lines.text: You used to go to Worth's place a whole lot. What makes you sure it wasn't there?

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: Well, maybe it was. I don't remember.  You got to do something for me, I can't stand it any longer -- I can't!

lines.speaker: u7213
lines.text: What is it? What happened?

lines.speaker: u7206
lines.text: Don't ask any questions. Come on!

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: You are too gracious. These things have some merit, I suspect ... but this--  ... I am convinced, is fine.

lines.speaker: u7207
lines.text: Even those delicate veins, the texture of this flesh -- I have never seen anything more exquisite.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: My partner believes that I should build a horror chamber, immortalizing the hideous crimes and criminals of London. At such times Marie Antoinette has reassured me, she has promised me recognition for the devotion I gave to her.

lines.speaker: u7207
lines.text: She will undoubtedly keep her promise. If you'll grant me the privilege, I'd like to submit this work to the Royal Academy when I get back.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: You will have won the undying gratitude of us all.  Is that not so, Marie Antoinette?

lines.speaker: u7207
lines.text: I regret I can't spend the time I'd like with your exhibition, but I'm going to worry the life out of you when I come back.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: It will always afford me great pleasure to see you.

lines.speaker: u7207
lines.text: Good night, sir.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: Good night.  And I am very grateful to you.

lines.speaker: u7212
lines.text: I'd know him anywhere.

lines.speaker: u7208
lines.text: Don't lose sight of him. This is the most important thing in my life.

lines.speaker: u7214
lines.text: Yep. Everything settled.

lines.speaker: u7213
lines.text: Good. Well, I'll be seeing you.

lines.speaker: u7214
lines.text: I'm glad they didn't hold you downtown.

lines.speaker: u7213
lines.text: They didn't have a leg to stand on. There's no case against me. It's a clumsy thing to have happen, but nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: u7214
lines.text: Well, any time I can do anything for you --

lines.speaker: u7213
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: u7217
lines.text: Mia...?

lines.speaker: u7215
lines.text: Yes....

lines.speaker: u7217
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u7216
lines.text: So I can move on.  You too.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: u7218
lines.text: Is Rose here?

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: She must have gone out for a walk with the children.

lines.speaker: u7218
lines.text: Well, I got to see her.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: She isn't here. And I'm sorry, but Mr. Hillyer doesn't want her to have callers during working hours.

lines.speaker: u7218
lines.text: Where is she?

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: I said she isn't here. NOW you go home. Be a nice boy and go home.

lines.speaker: u7219
lines.text: They're filthy, Mother.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: Sex isn't ugly, sex is one of the most beautiful things in life, the creative power of the universe is behind it.

lines.speaker: u7219
lines.text: I know, Mother.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: But we must respect that power, we must be in awe of it.

lines.speaker: u7219
lines.text: I am in awe of it, Mother.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: I don't think you are sufficiently in awe of it. Get the castor oil.

lines.speaker: u7219
lines.text: Oh, Mother, not the castor oil.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: This isn't punishment, I don't believe in punishment. It's for your health. Obviously you're sick if you can act like that.

lines.speaker: u7223
lines.text: Why is it taking so long?

lines.speaker: u7220
lines.text: Here comes Daddy.

lines.speaker: u7221
lines.text: Rose... I hate to be mean, but...  Oh, nevermind, forget it.

lines.speaker: u7227
lines.text: What was it, Mr. Hillyer?

lines.speaker: u7221
lines.text: Nothing, Rose.

lines.speaker: u7222
lines.text: You might see her. She writes your Daddy, and she and that doctor came to see him, didn't they? I wish you'd tell her something... I never could write letters.

lines.speaker: u7229
lines.text: What do you want me to tell her, Dave?

lines.speaker: u7222
lines.text: Oh, to hell with it, never mind. Don't tell her anything. Don't even tell her you saw me.  Got to run, Buddy, I'll miss my plane.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: What's the matter with him?

lines.speaker: u7223
lines.text: I don't know. I think he's cryin'!

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: I will not cry like a woman. If I'm upset it's because of what my husband said, not because of you. You can't make me cry like a woman, a woman has got just as much intelligence and self-control as a man. And you get this in your head. If you hurt that girl, I'll hire lawyers and sue you for malpractice for every penny you have got, I'll do my level best to ruin you. Do you understand me?

lines.speaker: u7224
lines.text: Yes, I understand you, but you have misunderstood me completely.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: I understand you perfectly. You leave that girl alone, you wretched man, or you will be sorry.

lines.speaker: u7224
lines.text: Actually of course I won't operate, I don't do major surgery. Dr. Hardy will operate and of course he'll be guided by your wishes in this respect.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: Let him be guided not by my wishes and not by Rose's wishes, although I am sure they are identical. Let him be guided by the wishes of the creative power of life itself, because that is what has spoken through me tonight.

lines.speaker: u7225
lines.text: Well, she finally let me look in her mouth. Is it true she's never been to a dentist?

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: She was raised on a poor dirt farm. I'm sure she's never seen a dentist or hardly even a doctor.

lines.speaker: u7225
lines.text: Well, she has one mouth in ten thousand, I don't see teeth like that once in ten years. Her trouble is an impacted wisdom tooth, but there isn't a cavity in her head, not a single one. She has perfect teeth.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: But the wisdom tooth will have to be pulled?

lines.speaker: u7225
lines.text: Yes, and it's very bad. It probably should be done at the hospital under general anesthesia.

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: That would scare her to death. She's terrified of hospitals. To her, a hospital is where you go to die.

lines.speaker: u7225
lines.text: I think you're right, it would be harder on her. But you'd better call Mr. Hillyer, she's going to need help to get home.

lines.speaker: u7227
lines.text: You'll never guess what happened!  I have met Mr. Right! I been with him all day and he loves me, I know he does, he loves me and he's going to marry met Be's practi'cly ast me already!

lines.speaker: u7226
lines.text: Well... well, that's wonderful, Rose.

lines.speaker: u7227
lines.text: And who do you suppose he is? That policeman who arrested me, the one I bit! He is Mr. Right!

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: Hasn't he got enough problems, or didn't you notice that's not cream soda on his breath?

lines.speaker: u7230
lines.text: ... okay... you made your point.

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: We'll take the CalTrust heist, but if it's no good, we will hunt you down, and Billy-Boy will pull out your spine and he will beat you to death with it.

lines.speaker: u7231
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.speaker: u7232
lines.text: Three hundred kilos of White Lady hidden inside a giant bust of Abraham Lincoln.  A parade float.

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: What... ?

lines.speaker: u7232
lines.text: Abe Lincoln...

lines.speaker: u7233
lines.text: It's bone dry out there.  Everybody's hurting.  The stuff floating around's been cut so many times it's like powdered sugar, but Zimnermann's gonna fix it.

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: I need the "when" and the "where."

lines.speaker: u7233
lines.text: I don't know, okay?  All I know is Butch Cassidy's back in town.

lines.speaker: u7234
lines.text: He tried to kill us.

lines.speaker: u7238
lines.text: We've got the tape to prove it.

lines.speaker: u7238
lines.text: He went to pick up lunch.

lines.speaker: u7235
lines.text: Well, shake a leg.  Get these files downstairs...  And, quit listening to your fucking voodoo music.

lines.speaker: u7238
lines.text: Yes, sir.

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: Don't you condescend to tell me how or why to honor Independence Day, and don't tell me I'm overreacting when I'm trying to bust the guy responsible for half the filthy junk coming into this city!

lines.speaker: u7236
lines.text: You're about an inch away from insubordination!

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: Well... seeing how you just suspended me, what's to stop me from calling you a crazy bastard, you old fart?

lines.speaker: u7236
lines.text: Till the last firework fizzles out tonight, detective, you sit a desk. And, after that, I'll decide if you keep your shield.

lines.speaker: u7239
lines.text: Where's your pet gorilla and the female Uncle Tom?

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: They're... around.

lines.speaker: u7239
lines.text: Yeah?  So, what do you want to ask today that I can't answer?  I'm a busy man.

lines.speaker: u7237
lines.text: The way Zimmermann takes such good care of you and this drug-peddling "escort service" of yours, I figure you got the scoop on the pharmaceuticals arriving tonight.

lines.speaker: u7239
lines.text: Well, let me tell you how it is...

lines.speaker: u7241
lines.text: The shield is down! Commence attack on theDeath Star's main reactor.

lines.speaker: u7247
lines.text: We're on our way. Red Group, Gold Group, all fighters follow me.  Told you they'd do it!

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: But you can't let her get involved now, Ben. Vader will destroy her.

lines.speaker: u7242
lines.text: She hasn't been trained in the ways of the Jedi the way you have, Luke... but the Force is strong with her, as it is with all of your family. There is no avoiding the battle. You must face and destroy Vader!

lines.speaker: u7243
lines.text: Shhh. You have hibernation sickness.

lines.speaker: u7245
lines.text: I can't see.

lines.speaker: u7243
lines.text: Your eyesight will return in time.

lines.speaker: u7245
lines.text: Where am I?

lines.speaker: u7243
lines.text: Jabba's palace.

lines.speaker: u7245
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: u7244
lines.text: Oh, no, my young Jedi. You will find that it is you who are mistaken...about a great many things.

lines.speaker: u7252
lines.text: His lightsaber.

lines.speaker: u7251
lines.text: Oh, Princess Leia, are you all right?

lines.speaker: u7245
lines.text: Let's see.

lines.speaker: u7252
lines.text: That is correct, Commander. And he is most displeased with your apparent lack of progress.

lines.speaker: u7246
lines.text: We shall double our efforts.

lines.speaker: u7252
lines.text: I hope so, Commander, for your sake. The Emperor is not as forgiving as I am.

lines.speaker: u7253
lines.text: There it is!

lines.speaker: u7247
lines.text: All right, Wedge. Go for the power regulator on the north tower.

lines.speaker: u7253
lines.text: Copy, Gold Leader. I'm already on my way out.

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: Yes. It's you Leia.

lines.speaker: u7248
lines.text: I know. Somehow...I've always known.

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: Then you know why I have to face him.

lines.speaker: u7248
lines.text: No! Luke, run away, far away. If he can feel your presence, then leave this place. I wish I could go with you.

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: No, you don't. You've always been strong.

lines.speaker: u7248
lines.text: But, why must you confront him?

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: Because...there is good in him. I've felt it. He won't turn me over to the Emperor. I can save him. I can turn him back to the good side. I have to try.

lines.speaker: u7249
lines.text: Well, I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: u7254
lines.text: Remember, a Jedi's strength flows from the Force.  But beware.  Anger, fear, aggression. The dark side are they.  Once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny.

lines.speaker: u7250
lines.text: Ah, good. New acquisitions. You are a protocol droid, are you not?

lines.speaker: u7251
lines.text: I am See-Threepio, human-cy...

lines.speaker: u7250
lines.text: Yes or no will do.

lines.speaker: u7251
lines.text: Oh. Well, yes.

lines.speaker: u7250
lines.text: How many languages do you speak?

lines.speaker: u7251
lines.text: I am fluent in over six million forms of communication, and can readily...

lines.speaker: u7250
lines.text: Splendid! We have been without an interpreter since our master got angry with our last protocol droid and disintegrated him.

lines.speaker: u7251
lines.text: Disintegrated?

lines.speaker: u7255
lines.text: Good God.

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u7256
lines.text: You did right.

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: A decision had to be made.

lines.speaker: u7256
lines.text: You're OK by me.

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: Dr Scott I'm sorry about your nephew.

lines.speaker: u7256
lines.text: Yes, well perhaps it was for the best.

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: You must leave now Dr Scott while it's still possible.  We are about to beam the entire house back to the planet of transexual in the galaxy of Transylvania. Go now.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Feeling

lines.speaker: u7258
lines.text: Like I'm outside in the rain

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Wheeling

lines.speaker: u7258
lines.text: Free to try and find a game

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Dealing

lines.speaker: u7258
lines.text: Cards for sorrow, Cards for pain.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7263
lines.text: Oh no no no no.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7263
lines.text: No no no no.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime. That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7263
lines.text: No no no no.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7263
lines.text: No no no no.

lines.speaker: u7259
lines.text: Sha la la la That ain't no crime - That ain't no crime.

lines.speaker: u7260
lines.text: Who's Eddie?

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: The delivery boy.

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: Our noble mission is almost completed my most beautiful sister, soon we will return to the moon-drenched shores of our "androgenous" planet.

lines.speaker: u7261
lines.text: Ah - sweet Transexual - land of night - to sing and dance once more to your dark refrains.  To take that step to the right...

lines.speaker: u7262
lines.text: But it's the pelvic thrust that really drives you insane.

lines.speaker: u7261
lines.text: And our World will do the Time Warp again.

lines.speaker: u7280
lines.text: You busted?!

lines.speaker: u7264
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: u7280
lines.text: You a virgin? -- Ya let 'im in ya pants, didn't ya!  Ya pulled down ya pants an' let him have it, didn't ya!!

lines.speaker: u7265
lines.text: Me an' my wife are goin' home 'cause we miss our children an' can't go no more time without seein' them.

lines.speaker: u7269
lines.text: Any quick advice for young boxing hopefuls?

lines.speaker: u7265
lines.text: ...Stay in school an' use your brains, dig -- Be a lawyer, be a doctor, carry a leather briefcase an' forget about sports!! Sports can only make ya grunt an' smell -- Be a thinker not a stinker!!

lines.speaker: u7266
lines.text: I don't like ya face.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Don't like yours neither.

lines.speaker: u7266
lines.text: Kiss my ass.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Move your shoulders down.

lines.speaker: u7267
lines.text: We'll kill you, man -- We gotta gun.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Pull heat on me? -- I'll dent ya face!

lines.speaker: u7268
lines.text: ...How 'bout for the Cokes?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Charge it.

lines.speaker: u7270
lines.text: Without a doubt this is the most punishing brawl I have ever seen -- The ringside audience is spotted with blood. This fight should have been stopped rounds ago but Rocky Balboa refuses to fall --

lines.speaker: u7271
lines.text: Not only has he refused to fall, but he has beaten the Champion's body without mercy and the bout has become a vicious slugfest.

lines.speaker: u7272
lines.text: Yo' yellow, old man.

lines.speaker: u7277
lines.text: Not yellow, cautious.  See, it's very easy for a fighter to accidentally hurt --

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: ...The juice is climbin' every week.

lines.speaker: u7273
lines.text: I know the juice is climbin' -- I been workin' six months just to pay the damn interest.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Ya still light seventy.

lines.speaker: u7273
lines.text: Waits! -- Be smart. Ya don't have to break nothin' -- Here, take my coat, it's worth fifty-sixty dollars. It's yours.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Yo, you gonna show, Tony?

lines.speaker: u7274
lines.text: Where else am I gonna go.  Bet three grand on Rocky.

lines.speaker: u7275
lines.text: Rocky, would you be interested in fighting Apollo Creed for the Championship?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: ...Like I said, I'd make a boss sparrin' mate.

lines.speaker: u7275
lines.text: Did you hear what I said?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Sure, an' I'm smart enough to know that no sparrin' partner should take cheap shots at the Champ. He's just there to help condition the man.

lines.speaker: u7275
lines.text: Not spar, I'm asking whether you would be interested in fighting Creed for the championship.

lines.speaker: u7276
lines.text: Goodnight, Rocky.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: 'Night, Marie.

lines.speaker: u7277
lines.text: I don't care what they say, you're a winner.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Yo, can I have my locker back?

lines.speaker: u7278
lines.text: No more, ya wanna lose an eye? No more.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Open my eyes -- Please, open my eyes!

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: ...What kinda dog is this again?

lines.speaker: u7279
lines.text: Bullmastiff.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: The owner was suppose to pick him up three weeks ago.

lines.speaker: u7279
lines.text: We're not responsible for animals left over thirty days -- We board it ain't a animal shelter, Y'know... Adrian, I want you to clean all those cat cages downstairs, they're a mess.

lines.speaker: u7280
lines.text: ...I can't haul meat no more.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: What can I do about it?

lines.speaker: u7280
lines.text: Christ, I been beggin' ya for a break until I'm sick inside.

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: What break? Huh? What break! Who am I to give breaks! I'm a fighter, you haul meat. You do what you do an' I do what I do best -- that's it -- that's life, man!

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: I'll tear his head off.

lines.speaker: u7281
lines.text: Do you have anything derogatory to say about the Champion?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Derogatory? Yeah, he's great.

lines.speaker: u7282
lines.text: Is it true the most you've ever made in a prizefight is five hundred dollars?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Four hundred -- But that was a long time ago.

lines.speaker: u7282
lines.text: And now your payday will be one hundred and fifty thousand dollars. Any comment?

lines.speaker: u7283
lines.text: Listen, I wanna say hi to my girlfriend -- Yo, Adrian!

lines.speaker: u7285
lines.text: My hunch is it was Maroon.  He always was after Acme's property.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Yeah?  Does he wear pants this color?

lines.speaker: u7286
lines.text: Gee, it's swell to see you, Eddie.  We miss you in Toontown.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Wish I could say the same.  What're you doin' here, Betty?

lines.speaker: u7286
lines.text: Work's been slow for me since the cartoons went to color.  But I still got it, Eddie...  'Boop boop be-doop'.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Yeah, you still got it, Betty.  Who's Mr. Jocularity?

lines.speaker: u7286
lines.text: That's Marvin Acme, the gag king.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Shoulda guessed.

lines.speaker: u7286
lines.text: He comes here every night to see Jessica Rabbit.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Big on the musical comedy, huh?

lines.speaker: u7286
lines.text: Sounds like you ve never seen her, Eddie.

lines.speaker: u7294
lines.text: Please, Raoul.  I can give you stars, I know I can.  Just drop the safe on my head one more time.

lines.speaker: u7287
lines.text: I've already dropped it on you twenty-three times.

lines.speaker: u7294
lines.text: Don't worry about me.  I can take it.

lines.speaker: u7287
lines.text: I'm not worried about you.  I'm worried about the safe.

lines.speaker: u7288
lines.text: I was hopin' you'd be there.  Maroon's called here about four times.  He says he's gotta talk to you tonight.  He says he can help you.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: I'll bet.

lines.speaker: u7288
lines.text: Are you gonna call him, Eddie?

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: What've I got to lose?  You okay, Dolores?

lines.speaker: u7288
lines.text: Yeah... they closed me down for a coupla weeks.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: That'll work out just fine.  When this thing is over, I'll take you to Catalina.  How does that sound?

lines.speaker: u7288
lines.text: Familiar.  Be careful, Eddie.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: You?

lines.speaker: u7289
lines.text: That's right, me.

lines.speaker: u7290
lines.text: You're a pig... a happy-go-lucky pig.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: u7290
lines.text: Does it hurt?

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Not much.  It's hard to talk.

lines.speaker: u7290
lines.text: Uh, Eddie, do me a favor.  Could you sit in the back so you won't cause as much of a commotion.

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Hold on a second.

lines.speaker: u7291
lines.text: Eddie, come on.

lines.speaker: u7292
lines.text: What the hell is that?

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Doom.

lines.speaker: u7292
lines.text: Jesus Christ... <u>that</u> was the Judge?

lines.speaker: u7293
lines.text: You got the will in there, don't ya?

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: No, I don't.

lines.speaker: u7293
lines.text: You tricked me, damn you!

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Take it easy.

lines.speaker: u7293
lines.text: There's no time to take it easy!  You don't realize the diabolical mind we're dealing with!

lines.speaker: u7295
lines.text: Pretty good cigar.  Where'd you get it?

lines.speaker: u7294
lines.text: From this box here...

lines.speaker: u7296
lines.text: Quarrel sir! no, sir.

lines.speaker: u7308
lines.text: If you do, sir, I am for you.  I serve as good a man as you.

lines.speaker: u7296
lines.text: No better?

lines.speaker: u7308
lines.text: Uh? Uh?

lines.speaker: u7307
lines.text: Live and be prosperous; and farewell good fellow.

lines.speaker: u7297
lines.text: Then I'll leave thee.

lines.speaker: u7307
lines.text: Tempt not a desperate man!
